intro: Psoralea stipulacea, commonly known as the stipulate psoralea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and compound leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its seeds are encased in a hard pod, and it is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Psoralea stipulacea is also known for its medicinal properties, used traditionally in some African communities for various health purposes.
